description.text: $\textit{Conductance}$, for a resistive two-terminal element or two-terminal circuit with terminals A and B, quotient of the electric current i in the element or circuit by the voltage $u_{AB}$ between the terminals: $G = \frac{1}{R}$, where the electric current is taken as positive if its direction is from A to B and negative in the opposite case. The conductance of an element or circuit is the inverse of its resistance.
